risks.name: Credit Risk
risks.details: The risk that a borrower or counterparty will default on their loan obligations.

risks.name: Operational risk
risks.details: The risk of loss due to errors, interruptions, or damages caused by people, systems, or processes.

risks.name: Market risk
risks.details: The risk that a bank will experience losses due to changes in market conditions such as interest rates, commodity prices, and exchange rates.

risks.name: Liquidity risk
risks.details: The risk that a bank will not have enough cash on hand to meet its funding obligations.

risks.name: Business or strategic risk
risks.details: The risk that a bank's business strategy will not be successful in the long term.

risks.name: Compliance risk
risks.details: The risk that a bank will fail to comply with laws, regulations, and standards.

risks.name: Cybersecurity risk
risks.details: The risk that a bank's electronic information will be damaged, misused, or stolen.

risks.name: Reputation risk
risks.details: The risk that a bank's reputation will be damaged due to negative publicity or other factors.

risks.name: Systemic risk
risks.details: The risk that a bank's failure will have a significant impact on the entire financial system.

risks.name: Moral hazard
risks.details: The risk that a bank will take on too much risk because it knows that it will be bailed out by the government or another party if things go wrong.

risks.name: Open banking risk
risks.details: The risk that a bank's data will be compromised when it is shared with third-party providers in an open banking ecosystem.
